thread.title: NSW Flood warning issued at 11:45am EDT
thread.title_full: NSW Flood warning issued at 11:45am EDT

title: NSW Flood warning issued at 11:45am EDT
text: Home › Weather Warning Summary › Potential Flood Alert 1 Weather Warnings - Potential Flood Alert 1 Australian Government Bureau of MeteorologyNew South WalesFLOOD WATCH FOR THE MORUYA AND BEGA RIVER VALLEYS Issued at 11:45 am EDT on Thursday 2 March 2017Note: This Flood Watch provides early advice for possible future flooding alongall rivers, creeks and overland flow paths within a nominated valley [See notebelow].A weak low pressure system may form off the southern or central New South Walescoast late on Friday or on Saturday. Dependent on the development and movementof the low pressure system, this system may produce periods of heavy rainfallalong parts of the Illawarra and South Coast from Friday into the weekend.This weather system has the potential to cause flooding to develop in thefollowing river valleys from Friday onwards: 1. Moruya - minor floodingThis Flood Watch means that people living or working along rivers and streamsmust monitor the latest weather forecasts and warnings and be ready to move tohigher ground should flooding develop. Flood Warnings will be issued if MinorFlood Level is expected to be exceeded at key sites along the main rivers forwhich the Bureau of Meteorology provides a flood warning service. Across NSW,about 70% of Flood Watches are followed by flooding.FloodSafe advice is available at www.ses.nsw.gov.au For emergency assistance call the SES on telephone number 132 500.For life threatening emergencies, call 000 immediately. Weather Forecast:For the latest weather forecast see www.bom.gov.au/nsw/forecasts/Next Issue:This flood watch will will be reviewed by 11 am Friday [03/03/17].For latest rainfall and river level information see www.bom.gov.au/nsw/flood/ Go!
